newsitem.title: USA: Boole & Babbage to acquire MAXM.
newsitem.headline: Boole & Babbage to acquire MAXM.

text.p: Boole & Babbage Inc Tuesday said it reached an agreement to acquire MAXM Systems Corp, a privately-held $20 million supplier of event management software for distributed systems.
In a statement, Boole said the agreement, approved by the respective boards of directors, is subject to government regulatory approval and is expected to close in January 1997.
Under the agreement, Boole will issue up to 1,189,655 post-split shares of common stock currently valued at nearly $25 million.
A majority of MAXM's shareholders have agreed to vote for the acquisition which will be accounted for as a pooling of interests, Boole & Babbage said.

Boole & Babbage said it expects to take a one-time charge against its earnings during the quarter in which the acquisition is completed to account for the deal. But the company did not disclose how much the charge would be.
Boole & Babbage said the acquisition enhances its position as a leading provider of highly scalable, wide-reaching event and availability management products for distributed systems.
